roleset.name: (cause) to be similar, comply

example.name: conform-v: transitive
example.text: `` This conforms to the ` soft landing ' scenario , '' said [] Elliott Platt , an economist at Donaldson , Lufkin& Jenrette Securities Corp .

example.name: conform-v: with temporal adverbial
example.text: Americans are expected [*] to conform to the Japanese culture when [*-3]in Japan [*T*-2] .

example.name: conform-v: conform with
example.text: Responses were weighted [*] on the basis of age and gender [*]to conform with U.S. Census data .

example.name: conform-v: with agent
example.text: The Committee on Federal Regulation of Securities for the American Bar Association argues, for example, in its lengthy letter to the SEC, that the proposed changes ``would substantially improve the [law]by [*] conforming it more closely to contemporary business realities.''

roleset.note: CONFORM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'conform' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Comparison with 'follow'. (from conform.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: structural configuration, esp. of atoms, animals

role.descr: entity taking on a structural configuration
specific rings of atoms or sub-part of arg1 involved

example.name: conformation-n
example.text: The chair conformation of six membered rings have a dihedral angle of 60Â° between adjacent substituents thus usually making it the most stable conformer.

example.name: conformation-n
example.text: There is a friendliness about the natural conformation of the land which makes it seem homelike before one stone is laid upon another...

example.name: conformation-n
example.text: Conformation of the Ideal Humerus (all measurements are while the horse is standing squarely): the angle of the shoulder blade and upper arm should be between 100-120 degrees
example.arg: the angle of the shoulder blade and upper arm should be between 100-120 degrees

roleset.note: CONFORM-V NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth biotexts.
